page.title: 11THE OLD SCHOOL HOUSE
page.content: There is an old school house down the road near the church in Lenton.It has a sign still on the wall.It is one of the oldest buildings in Lenton.It was a Dame school,the first educational building in our area. The house was built in about 1630 as two cottages, it was converted into a school in 1790 Sir Gilbert Heathcote donated some money and other landowners joined with him to convert the two cottages into a school.There was a rent levy for the parishes of Lenton and Hanby of 37s to help with the conversion. The teachers salary was Â£33 7s 8d for seven years.
